Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2009 10:18PM - edited Sep 20, 2009 08:15PM by Katie12 Please read my personal story with research at the site below.  There are so many things that we are deliberately not told.  We have to become our own best advocates.  http://mammogramsanddcis.blogspot.com
Posts.Title: How long is it supposed to take? CoolBreeze CoolBreeze

Posts.Content: Katie12 wrote: There would be a thousand times' less chance of a woman's cancer reaching stage IV in the first place if there were not so much secrecy regarding the use of MRI for screening.  MRI is light years better than mammography, but is kept secret from all but 20-30% of women.  I am outraged by what I discovered during my experience of the disease.   I took my anger out on the keypad and wrote at story posted at   http://mammogramsanddcis.blogspot.com  (mammograms and dcis). Please read my story.  It could save your life.   Katherine Dx 11/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mammography & Metastatic Breast Ca Katie12 china
